title: Ticket #7709: Ensure that error messages in the Blahp appear in the GridmanagerLog
description:
I was troubleshooting a Bosco issue where I saw the following unhelpful error message in the GridmanagerLog 

06/02/20 22:09:49 (D_ALWAYS:2) [2092] GAHP[2148] <- 'BLAH_JOB_STATUS 247 slurm/20200602/1379624'
06/02/20 22:09:49 (D_ALWAYS:2) [2092] GAHP[2148] -> 'S'
06/02/20 22:09:49 (D_ALWAYS:2) [2092] GAHP[2148] <- 'RESULTS'
06/02/20 22:09:49 (D_ALWAYS:2) [2092] GAHP[2148] -> 'S' '1'
06/02/20 22:09:49 (D_ALWAYS:2) [2092] GAHP[2148] -> '245' '1' 'Error parsing classad or job not found' '0' 'N/A'

I didn't have direct access to the CE or remote login host but I was able to run local universe jobs, so I could use "condor_ce_run -l" (think condor_run, submitting a local universe job) to get the actual failure: 

$ condor_ce_run -lr $ce /bin/sh -c 'ssh notchpeak1.chpc.utah.edu bosco/glite/bin/slurm_status.py slurm/20200602/1379624'
1ERROR: global name 'os' is not defined

It'd be great if we could ensure that all of these types of errors are available in the GridmanagerLog.
creator: blin
